headline: Arizona Senator Mark Kelly introduces plan to save money on gas
sentences: WASHINGTON D.C., DC â€” Some Democratic senators are calling for suspending the federal gas tax for the remainder of the year to help consumers struggling with rising fuel prices.
Mark Kelly of Arizona and Maggie Hassan of New Hampshire could prove popular during an election year when the average price of gas nationally exceeds about $3.45 a gallon.
Over the years, lawmakers have visited the idea of suspending the gas tax but did not generate enough support.
Catch up on the latest news and stories on the 12 News YouTube channel.
The bill announced Wednesday faces an uphill fight to become law.
The federal gas tax has been 18.4 cents per gallon since 1993.
The price could go higher during peak driving season.
